bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, October 20, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, October 20, 1891
Mr Beverly Y. Payne, To the Department of State.
Advice of transmission of the deposition of Frank Nelson to Messer Nichols and Cobb Boston.
Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, October 20, 1891.
Hon., William F. Wharton, Acting Secretary of State Washington D. C.

Sir: Referring to my No 22 of the 18th ultimo, I have the honor of informing the Department, that I have transmitted to Messers, Nichols and Cobb 40 Water Street, Boston, a copy of the deposition of Frank Nelson, of Boston, in the case Poland et a. vs Subtonstall et al, as taken by the Consular Agent at Elmina, Gold Coast Colony
Colony, September 5, 1890, in accordance with a Commission, issued Jun 11, 1890, by the United States Circuit Court of the District of Mass.
A copy of same, I had the honor of transmitting to the Department with my Consular Despatch No 15, of June 26, 1891.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant,
Beverly Y. Payne, Vice Consul Gen.
